title: Macron’s pension reforms spark further violence in Paris
description: Riot police used tear gas to disperse protesters throwing stones and setting fires in the French capital, as angry confrontation continues over changes to national retirement rules.

title: Athletes from Russia and Belarus should be allowed to compete, IOC says
description: GENEVA — Some Russian athletes can soon return to international sports, although their status for next year’s Paris Olympics is still up in the air.

title: Britain raises domestic threat level for Northern Ireland to 'severe'
description: Britain’s MI5 intelligence agency has increased the threat level from domestic terrorism to Northern Ireland to “severe,” meaning an attack is highly likely.

title: Police brace for violence as France sees new wave of pension protests
description: Protests and strikes against unpopular pension reforms kicked off again Tuesday across France, with police security ramped up against feared violence and government warnings that radical demonstrators intend “to destroy, to injure and to kill.”

title: Netanyahu suspends judicial reform after massive protests
description: Amid unprecedented protests, Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu has put the government’s controversial judicial reform plans on hold, saying he wanted to “avoid civil war.” NBC News’ Raf Sanchez breaks down how protesters are reacting to Netanyahu’s comments and whether it’s enough to quell the unrest.

title: At least 39 killed in fire at migrant center in Juarez, Mexico
description: Officials in Mexico say at least 39 people were killed and dozens more injured after a fire broke out at a Juarez migrant center near the U.S. border. NBC News’ Julia Ainsley has the details.

title: Scotland's 'oldest' tartan found in Highlands bog
description: A piece of fabric discovered in a bog in the Scottish Highlands might be the oldest traditional tartan ever found, new research suggests.

title: India can't find a separatist religious leader, but its manhunt has got the world's attention
description: A massive manhunt in India for Sikh separatist leader Amritpal Singh has seen authorities enforce a statewide internet blackout in Punjab.

title: Fire at migration center on U.S.-Mexico border leaves dozens dead
description: At least 39 people were killed after a fire broke out at a migration center along the U.S.-Mexico border run by the National Migration Institute in Ciudad Juarez, officials said.

title: North Korea unveils new nuclear warheads as U.S. air carrier arrives in South
description: North Korea unveiled new, smaller nuclear warheads and vowed to produce more weapons-grade nuclear material to expand the country’s arsenal, state news agency KCNA said Tuesday.

title: White House sees Netanyahu likely abandoning judicial overhaul to pursue compromise
description: The Biden administration believes that Israel’s far-right government has likely abandoned its divisive plan to overhaul the nation’s judiciary.
